abstract: Consumers shopping for health insurance on Affordable Care Act's marketplace will have new option of standardized health plans that will cover basic services without deductible; plans are meant to address concerns from many consumers over very high deductibles in many health plans, but could still be costly, since federal government does not limit premiums.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Many consumers will have a new option when the insurance marketplace opens in two weeks: standardized plans that cover basic services without a deductible.
snippet: Many consumers will have a new option when the insurance marketplace opens in two weeks: standardized plans that cover basic services without a deductible....

headline.main: HealthCare.gov Will Add ‘Simple Choice’ Plans in Effort to Improve Value
headline.print_headline: HealthCare.gov Will Add ‘Simple Choice’ Plans in Effort to Improve Value
